attributes.action: Investigate motor insurance policy pricing to ensure it is fair for everyone.
attributes.background: Motor insurance is a legal requirement and a social utility, but the transparency in policy pricing and post inception activities of insurers in recent years, is disadvantaging consumers and was not addressed in the Competitions and Markets Authority's investigate of 2013/14.
attributes.additional_details: The recent article from uSwitch.com, ( http://tinyurl.com/z2w83bh ), highlights that those seeking to save money by opting for third party only or third party fire and theft cover, are actually being charged more than for comprehensive cover. As motor insurance is a legal requirement, it is felt that insurance companies should be both transparent and accountable for their pricing structures, for such a economically vital, social utility as motor insurance, so that consumers are treated fairly.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Increase the bursary for training English teachers 2016-17
attributes.background:
The government are increasing the bursary for training English teachers from a minimum of £4,000 to £9,000 for all.
Many who are training to teach English this year will only receive £4,000 to cover living expenses. If they had applied this year they would receive over double the amount.
attributes.additional_details:
https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/overview

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/561599/Initial_teacher_training_bursaries_funding_manual_2017_to_2018.pdf

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: Fathers should not pay CSA if they don´t have access to their child
attributes.background: Mothers who claim CSA and do not let fathers see their child shouldn't be allowed to do so. A parent can´t have the best of both worlds claiming CSA and deny the other parent access, its not fair and its not right.
attributes.additional_details: I understand some cases are different i.e the other parent is dangerous for the child to stay with. In these cases CSA should still be available.

attributes.action: Vehicle tax (Road Fund Licence) per day, not month
attributes.background: Following the changes in vehicle tax, vehicle owners are now forced to surrender the value of the vehicle tax up until the end of the month in which they sell the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details:
Vehicle buyers are also forced to buy a full month, when they will not have had the use of the days preceeding the vehicle purchase.

It is also the case that the computer systems which coordinate the purchase of vehicle tax are given a concentrated workload at the end of each month. This has recently resulted in the service being unavailable.

I propose that vehicle tax should be available daily so that buyers and sellers are not short-changed, and that the systems are more able to cope with a more uniform demand.

This petition is of interest to anyone in the UK who will either buy or sell a motor vehicle.

Please rectify this unfair practice.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools with social media accounts to be set to private.
attributes.background: The primary school my children attend has a public Twitter profile that they post photos of the children on. 3 explicit Twitter profiles have retweeted and liked a photo of my child. It was brought to my attention that the school profile is public and it is not compulsory to have it set to private.
attributes.additional_details: A public twitter account allows anyone to access details of what school a child goes to, their name and also what they look like. The pictures can be saved by any person who wishes. The terrifying thing is that an individual doesn't even have to have a Twitter account themselves to access a public account. The school my children attend are refusing to make the account private as there is nothing to say they have to. I want it to be made compulsory for all schools with social media accounts to have them set to private.

attributes.action: Create mandatory recycling waste legislation in England
attributes.background: In Scotland - the regulations brought in, in January 2014, require all businesses and organisations to separate key materials – plastic, glass, metals, paper and card – for recycling, while most food businesses are also required to separate food waste for collection.
attributes.additional_details:
- See more at: http://www.zerowastescotland.org.uk/content/meeting-regulations-legislation#sthash.tem8wOF6.dpuf

The government needs to catch up with other, more forward thinking and environmentally aware countries to legislate on waste recycling as a matter or extreme urgency, to prevent the needless, toxic pollution of our earth, on which, all humans depend for their existence!

attributes.action: Not using signals correctly when driving should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: Introduce a fine for incorrect use of indicators at junctions and roundabouts.
attributes.additional_details: Incorrect use of signals cause unnecessary hold ups and leads to accidents

attributes.action: The abuse of a redhead should be made a criminal offence as a form of racism.
attributes.background:
It's racial abuse and harrassment and works the same as being harassed for having a different colour skin or having a different god. 
It is an 'accepted' form of abuse in society which is wrong as this amount of bullying and mental abuse is dangerous for a person's insecurities or mental health.
attributes.additional_details: I am a strong believer in this being a form of racism and I will never believe it is okay for people to be tortured for being different. People get trauma treatment and counselling due to insecurities and mental illness triggered by the abuse and harassment. People can be rejected from work, friendships, relationships and school events for it. It can have a long lasting impact on those affected and even lead people to suicide.

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally

attributes.action: Allow a step-father to be named on a marriage certificate.
attributes.background: Only the biological fathers name is currently permitted on a marriage certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
That's extremely unfair to the step-father's that do a better job and are more deserving of the title. With proof of a marriage certificate, we should be able to record the step-father's name on the form.
Step-fathers were previously permitted to be named, however that rule changed in February.

attributes.action: Instruct Southern Rail to reinvest all profits until they can run a full service
attributes.background: Southern Rail have been running a minimal and intermittant service while harvesting almost £100m in profit. Many of us will have had sympathy that they were dealing with a difficult situation with engineering work and civil action, however news that they are making such a profit shows otherwise.

attributes.action: Outlaw anti-abortion campaigns near health centres
attributes.background:
Blown-up, graphic images of abortion, and threats to film people attending BPAS surgeries are likely to scare vulnerable people away from the one place they could get state-sanctioned, impartial advice and assistance.

People have a right to express their views but not in a way that harms others.
attributes.additional_details:
It is well-documented that providing safe, non-judgemental access to health and family planning advice leads to an overall decrease in sexual-health related problems. Aggressive campaigning denies that access. 

Victims of abuse or rape, those who are unsure how to cope with pregnancy, contraceptives or sexual health issues might go away in fear then fail to seek help at all -  disastrous for the victims, and likely to create long-lasting problems for their families and social care services.

attributes.action: Require Theresa May to provide remaining £5.5bil of promised £10bil to the NHS
attributes.background: NHS is under extreme pressure. Of the £10bil promised to it over the course of the parliament (Theresa May, Birmingham 5/10/16, Jeremy Hunt 11/10/16) in reality, only £4.5bil is available. The Commons Public Accounts (3/11/16) & Health Committees (26/10/16) have demanded action but Gov fails to act.
attributes.additional_details:
The £10bil funding promise has not been delivered. Meg Hillier (Chair of the Public Accounts Committee) & Sarah Wollaston (Chair Health Committee) wrote very clear letters stating their grave concerns. 
UK health spending is falling as a proportion of GDP (King's Fund 2016) & the UK now lies 13th out of 15 European countries (OECD) for such.
This sustained underfunding & failure to enable long-term planning jeopardises the health & welfare of our citizens. Theresa May has a moral duty to act.

attributes.action: For the production, sale & use of whole plant medical cannabis to be legal.
attributes.background:
Exempts patients & defined caregivers who possess or cultivate marijuana for medical treatment recommended by a physician from criminal laws which otherwise prohibit possession or cultivation of marijuana.
Furthermore, legalise the sale of medical marijauna in dispensaries for these patients only.
attributes.additional_details:
Medical marijuana has been seen to improve the lives of some of the patients (in some cases reverse) with the following conditions: Alzheimer's disease, arthritis, ADHD, ASD, autoimmune diseases, cachexia, cancer, CFS, GI disorders , fibromyalgia, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, insomnia, MS, neuropathy, Parkinson's disease, PTSD, seizure disorders and many others.
Notably the whole plant as it's compounds work in synergy. 
Additionally, in all these cases the benefits far outweigh the supposed dangers.

attributes.action: We want the UK Government refuse to pay any exit payment to the EU on leaving
attributes.background: We are told that the UK could face a very large bill from the EU after Brexit. I have no doubt that the people of the UK will have to foot the bill in the way of some tax increase or other. The people of the UK should never have to pay to leave the EU, as we where never asked if we wanted to join.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on a income tax increase to help support the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is suffering from both drastic under-funding and the ongoing failure of any political party to address this issue. We seemingly cannot leave a decision on the future of the NHS to politicians and must help them find the courage to do what is necessary.

attributes.action: Make St.George's Day a national holiday, countries celebrate their Saint's Day
attributes.background: Now we are going to become an independent country, let's make us great again, and come together to celebrate our Saint George in style, and have a national holiday to celebrate every year, even if we swap it for , say , MAYDAY , bring it forward slightly, or add this in.

attributes.action: Make euthanasia legal in the UK in cases of Terminal illnesses & suffering
attributes.background: I've got end stage liver disease. Knowing the death I was facing I've  tried to euthanise myself lots in the last 2 years, almost successful, but sadly not. I'm now using up a bed at a Mental health rehab unit cos they have to protect me from myself, even though it's not a MH issue, & suffering
attributes.additional_details: If an animal was suffering with the pain & symptoms I, and many others are going through daily, keeping the animal alive would result in prosecution for cruelty. We allow animals dignity in dying, so why do we not offer this option, with extremely stringent procedures in place to protect the vulnerable, to fellow humans? I wanted to just fall asleep, instead I'm being forced to suffer Hepatic Encephalopathy & extreme pain, both of which are extremely distressing. Please help change the law!

attributes.action: Introduce Regular Digital Voting Referendums On The Issues That Matter
attributes.background: The technology for 'push-button digital voting' by mobile phone or pc already exists. People vote on tv show contestants all the time. Mobile and online banking are deemed to be secure. Thus there's no reason why this technology cannot be adapted for digital referendums to truly empower the people.
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister Theresa May has spoken of the 'shared society.' It would be nice to see some power being shared with our representatives at the UK Parliament and the devolved Parliaments and Assemblies. 

Regular digital voting on issues that matter at a local and national level, would leave everyone clear on what the majority wish for on any number of issues. A more intelligent vote could also arise; Eg: someone with good knowledge of farming would vote on it, though perhaps not vote on fishing.

attributes.action: Heavier prison scentences for pedophiles and rapists.
attributes.background: I firmly believe that the scentences handed out to pedophiles and rapists are far to lenient.When someone commits a crime against a child or rapes a person they are as good as murdering who that person once was
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has been raped or abused will tell you they will never be the same again...in essence the person they once were is now dead...children who are abused have their childhood stolen from them..the perpetrators of such unspeakble acts deserve to be punished severly and the victims at the very least deserve the justice that harsher scentences would bring

attributes.action: Declassify intelligence related to possible Russian interference on Brexit vote
attributes.background: The CIA, FBI and NSA jointly concluded that Vladimir Putin ordered an influence campaign on the 2016 US Election using social media and cyber attacks. Russia would benefit from a weakened European Union. We deserve to be sure the EU Referendum was a free and fair vote without influence.
attributes.additional_details:
US declassified report: https://www.dni.gov/files/documents/ICA_2017_01.pdf

EU sanctioned Russia over crisis in Syria: https://europa.eu/newsroom/highlights/special-coverage/eu_sanctions_en

Like the US Election, the EU Referendum result was not predicted by polls: http://whatukthinks.org/eu/opinion-polls/poll-of-polls/

MI6 Chief, Anthony Young, commented states "further their aims deniably" by "subversion of democratic process": https://www.ft.com/content/2a433552-bd4c-11e6-8b45-b8b81dd5d080

attributes.action: Stop the College of Policing requiring Police to have a degree before joining.
attributes.background: The College of policing are requiring new officers to have a degree or a 3 year apprenticeship before joining. Currently there are around 38% of officers who have a degree. As a current special constable alot of the officers I serve with haven't got a degree and their policing skills are fantastic!

attributes.action: Set up of a Men's Equality committee to address issues like male rape & suicide.
attributes.background:
There is already a Women & Equalities Committee, but it has not yet done any inquiries into issues facing men, such as; 
1* Suicide (three times as high in men) 
2* Male rape (where services for men are insufficient) 
3* Domestic violence against men (misreported as only affecting women).
attributes.additional_details:
1. suicide rates by gender 16.8 per 100,000 for men and 5.2 per 100,000 for women from Samaritans website http://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide 
2. 85,000 women and 12,000 men raped per year. http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
3. 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men - http://www.lwa.org.uk/understanding-abuse/statistics.htm”

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: Back date money owed by HMRC to families with disabled children
attributes.background: HMRC has announced that it will only pay back money owed to families with disabled children for 2016/17. This is wrong. Families living day to day with the challenges of supporting a disabled child are themselves vulnerable. HMRC must repay all DLA tax credits owed to these families without delay.

attributes.action: Amend voting age to reflect the school year
attributes.background:
This petition aims to grant the right to vote to second-year college students; in other words, to 17-year-olds who will pass their 18th birthday within the same school year as the vote.

We should recognise that students in the same school year have the same intellectual and cultural maturity.
attributes.additional_details:
To make an adequate generalisation about the societal and cultural awareness of young people, it would make much more sense to rely on their years of education; limiting voting by age is arbitrary.

For example, in the General Election 2015, students in their final year of college were only eligible to vote depending on whether their 18th birthday fell before or after May 7th. We should recognise that a period of a few days is inconsequential.

Colleges could then encourage youth participation.

attributes.action: Introduce daily meditation to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We wish to petition for meditation to be introduced into the national curriculum at nursery, primary and secondary levels. The benefits of daily meditation on a developing brain are endless. Focus, clarity, calm - fundamental qualities that can help a young mind stay healthy and happy into adulthood
attributes.additional_details:
"If every 8 year old in the world is taught meditation, we will eliminate violence from the world within one generation." - Dalai Lama

With ever rising rates of young suicides globally our young are becoming ever more detached and disenfranchised. Mental health is now a very serious issue for our growing generations. As little as 5 minutes of gentle meditation each morning will help our young to feel more connected to themselves and the world around them.

attributes.action: To build a new Northern bypass around Ipswich
attributes.background: The Orwell Bridge has been closed in Ipswich all morning due to high winds, causing traffic chaos and gridlock in the town, it's about time a Northern bypass around Ipswich was built to defer the traffic from the town when the bridge is closed.
attributes.additional_details: It's 2016 and it's ridiculous that such a large town is so reliant on the bridge being open, as soon as there's an accident or bad weather, it's closed and the traffic has nowhere to go but through the town, which the infrastructure just cannot cope, costing businesses millions of pounds in lost revenue, especially haulage companies as they're reliant on the a14 to and from the port of felixstowe, get this Northern bypass built.

attributes.action: Require that all single use drinks cups are 100% biodegradable.
attributes.background: Currently only around 1 in every 400 single use drinks cups, mainly used for takeaway coffee are recycled.  Many such cups end up littering our pavements, parks, beaches and rivers. It is time that all such cups should be 100% biodegradable to minimise their impact on the environment.

attributes.action: Fully and transparently explore the Hyperloop concept to deliver HS1 and HS2.
attributes.background:
The proposed HS1 and HS2 investments should deliver infrastructure for the future - but they are currently on-target to deploy a concept that hasn't improved since the Victorian era.

The Hyperloop is different. It offers the potential for high speeds and sustainability. We should evaluate it.
attributes.additional_details:
Full details of the design and rationale can be found here:

https://www.tesla.com/en_GB/blog/hyperloop

attributes.action: Introduce online cyber-security and forensics degree courses for UK residents.
attributes.background: I am requesting the UK Government to introduce affordable and highly rated cyber-security and forensic degree courses for people with hidden conditions and other people alike all over the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: This would fulfill the dreams for those wishing to pursue security degree courses. Most national cyber threats could be eliminated by simply introducing online degree course in conjunction with some of our reputed universities.

attributes.action: Phase out LED headlights.
attributes.background: LED headlights are a lot brighter than normal headlights and dazzle other drivers, particularly on dark roads (i.e. on country lanes). Please put safety above looks and phase out LED headlights by making them illegal in any future car productions.

attributes.action: Make dealing with panic attacks part of standard first aid courses/training
attributes.background: If we are going to treat mental health the same as any other illness or condition, it needs to be normalised and people need to be trained on how to manage a situation if someone has a panic attack. They are becoming increasingly common, particularly in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
At least 1 in 10 people suffer from panic attacks (NHS) - meaning on average at least 1 person in every small business may be a sufferer. Many people will be afraid of the symptoms which can be similar to those of a heart attack - so people need to be made aware of the tell-tale signs and how to manage them.
Hours of work are lost from anxiety related issues, so let's make our nation more open to talk and comfortable when dealing with anxiety and panic attacks.

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: Mobile phone use whilst driving have the same penalties as drink/drugs driving.
attributes.background: Mobile phone use whilst driving appears to be killing or maiming as many people as drink/drug related accidents, therefore should carry the same penalty.

attributes.action: Legislate against premature marketing of festivals, especially Christmas
attributes.background: The excitement of Christmas is spoiled by premature marketing in shops, 'papers and TV. We are not killjoys, but tinselled TV ads and festive trees in Malls in early November dwindles our joy well before the event. We propose, under penalty, the first day of marketing for Christmas as 1st of Dec.
attributes.additional_details: Other festivals can be included in legislation (e.g. 1 week prior to Valentines, Easter, Halloween) but the law must first target Christmas. We accept there are commercial ventures that that may be exempt since they rely on festivals such as Christmas for much of their business and therefore need to market early, e.g. Christmas hamper savings, turkey butchers, greeting card shops, booking for a Christmas party, etc. Punishments for breaking the law should raise money for children's charities.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Reinstate Postgraduate Loans To Other UK Citizens Living & Studying in England.
attributes.background: Appeal Against Student Finance England's decision to withdraw the funding of Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh Postgraduate Students living and studying in England.
attributes.additional_details: The SFE waited until all the Scottish, Northern Irish and Welsh students living and studying in England had registered with their University before blocking their payments without any warning or notification. The SFE should be held accountable of how they have treated so many UK non-English nationals resulting in them with no funding and being forced off their studies. Is Student Finance England discriminating against UK citizens who are non-English Nationals from access to Higher Education?

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: Parliament must vote on initial aims of Brexit and then trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: The country voted 52:48 to leave the EU in June and to make Parliament sovereign in the UK. To be sovereign, Parliament must therefore be able to vote on and scrutinise the initial aims for Brexit negotiations and then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered, not leaving it to royal prerogative.
attributes.additional_details: In determining the starting point of Brexit, our elected representatives must have the chance to properly scrutinise and vote on the aims of the negotiations. MPs must engage with their constituents and all stakeholders to represent us, the people, in determining what the aims of Brexit should be. Our elected MPs should then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered so negotiations start following these aims set out by Parliament. To be truly sovereign, Parliament must play its full role in Brexit.

attributes.action: Allow full legal costs to be taken into account by the Child Support Agency
attributes.background: When one partner decides to breakup a relationship and leave, taking the children and denying the other partner an acceptable level of access and/or communication, the only recourse the other partner has to achieve reasonable access to their children is to take very costly legal action.
attributes.additional_details: Also, if despite paying a reasonable level of maintenance based on previous household bills, the leaving partner uses the CSA to obtain the maximum possible then paying the resultant determination can drain any available funds to pay for legal costs. This creates a very uneven playing field and therefore, full legal costs should be taken into consideration by the CSA in order that a parent can legally fight for their rights.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a parent to allow child access to age inappropriate material
attributes.background: This needs to happen sooner rather than later because the technology is becoming more of the norm for young impressionable children and games that glorifying gang affiliations, drug dealing , mass shootings act now for our next generation of leaders

attributes.action: increase penalties for leaving the scene of an accident in a motor vehicle
attributes.background: I wish to increase the penalties emposed to drivers if found leaving the scene of an accident. I feel dissapointed that police do not enforce sufficient penalties for people who leave someone or something for dead at sides of roads after hitting them. same applies to accidents with vehicles
attributes.additional_details: Spring hill road - accrington - DOG Killed by speeding driver who made off, leaving owner at side of road in a state with no way of knowing who killed her dog. police was informed and she was told without a number plate we cant help.

attributes.action: bikers with a CBT dont have to ride with L plates after 2 years on the road
attributes.background: riding with L plates and riding without any L plates make no difference on a bike all they do is keep breaking off and left laying on the road making it a hazard
attributes.additional_details:
L plate left laying on the road is a hazard , it is a danger to other bikers it could pop a Tyre and cause serious body damage or even death 

it also can be just as dangerous to car drivers or buses/lorry's as if they cant control a blow out they could end up going in to a head on crash or in to a pedestrian walking on the pavement 

can also be a danger if a vehicle drives over  a L plate it could be brought up in the air and his a vehicle following behind

attributes.action: Create more awareness and help for Children affected and bereaved by Suicide.
attributes.background: Suicide is often a joke among people, this may affect one of the survivors of 4400 suicide attempts taken place per year. More should be done to raise empathy and support for bereaved/affected children in schools. Also there is a lack of widespread support available, e.g. specialised therapists.

attributes.action: Ask MP's to permanently relocate Parliament to a site in the middle of the UK
attributes.background: This represents a one off window of opportunity to move our primary democratic institution, the House of Commons, to a new site where MP's will be closer to real people and not the Metropolitan elite that dominates their mindset, processes and practices.
attributes.additional_details: It would represent a new start for our democracy, fit for the 21st Century and force our politicians to reassess and challenge the status quo.

attributes.action: Making it easier for adults to be diagnosed with autism
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with autism in my adult life, which was not easy to do, I want to help adults get help being diagnosed a lot easier

attributes.action: MAKE THE SPOUSAL VISA REQUIREMENTS ACHIEVABLE! STOP MAKING PEOPLES LIVES SO HARD
attributes.background: It Is Far Too Hard For People To Earn £18'600 Per Annum! Let Alone Have Savings Of £62'000! It Is Pathetic!!
attributes.additional_details: I Have Friends And Family Struggling Because Of This And It Is Just Not Right!!!
